article.description: U of the Pacific 71, UC Irvine 61
article.headline: U of the Pacific 71, UC Irvine 61
article.linkText: U of the Pacific 71, UC Irvine 61
article.story: STOCKTON, Calif. (AP) -- David Doubley scored a game-high 21 points Thursday night to lead Pacific to its 13th consecutive victory, 71-61 over UC Irvine. Guillaume Yango had 18 points and a game-high nine rebounds for the Tigers, who stretched their Big West Conference winning streak to 24 games. Pacific (17-2, 11-0 Big West) also got 12 points from Jasko Korajkic, who made four free throws in the final minute as the Tigers pulled away with a game-ending 10-4 run. Ross Schraeder led UC Irvine (10-8, 4-6) with 18 points and Greg Ethington added 17. Jeff Gloger had 12. Schraeder's 3-pointer gave the Anteaters their final lead at 48-46 with nine minutes to play. After Yango tied the game for the fifth and final time with two free throws, Doubley scored seven consecutive points to put Pacific in command. UC Irvine twice cut the lead to two points in the final six minutes but could get no closer. The Anteaters made their first five shots from the floor while grabbing an early 10-0 lead. Doubley responded with eight consecutive Pacific points as the Tigers slowly cut into the deficit. Pacific took its first lead on Yango's two free throws with 5:15 remaining in the half. An inside basket by Yango gave the Tigers a 30-26 edge at halftime -- Pacific's largest lead of the opening 20 minutes. Pacific's biggest lead of the night was the game's final margin.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
